div.p: PAUTHORSHIP is available within WRITING PRODUCTION . It enables discussion of issues surrounding a text's authorship. Use only where authorship or claims to authorship are some kind of issue: not where a text is merely flagged as “by Jane Jones” (unless such flagging is rare for this author). Encloses statement or debate, defined in the relevant attributes: AuthornameType, AuthorshipControversy, ControversyDate, and Collaboration.

div.codeblock: <PAUTHORSHIP> Joanna Baillie's A Series of Plays (one on love, one on hate) was published anonymously in 1798 and attributed to Sir Walter Scott.</PAUTHORSHIP>
<PAUTHORSHIP>In the convent, Lucy Cary (if not either her sister Ann or her sister Mary) wrote her mother's life, "by One of Her Daughters."</PAUTHORSHIP>

div.p: If you have a title-page saying the author is known as the Author of Jane Eyre, use the ALLUSIVE attribute. For a fuller discussion, see AuthorNameType
